article.headline: Southern Miss 70, So New Orleans 45
article.story: HATTIESBURG, Miss. (AP) -- Jeremy Wise scored 17 points as Southern Miss beat Southern-New Orleans 70-45 on Wednesday. The win ended a seven-game home stand for the Golden Eagles (7-0), the longest to begin the season for the school. The Golden Eagles are off to their best start since the 1985-86 season, when they also opened the year 7-0. Southern Miss played three NAIA schools during the stretch, including SUNO. SUNO (2-5) has yet to win a game on the court this season. The Knights, who dress only eight players, received a pair of forfeits over Concordia College due to use of an ineligible player. Southern Miss' Craig Craft scored eight straight points, including back-to-back 3-point shots, midway through the first half to begin a 22-1 Golden Eagles run. The spurt gave Southern Miss a commanding 36-12 lead with three minutes to play before halftime, and SUNO never threatened again. Courtney Beasley added 10 for Southern Miss, and the Golden Eagles had three players with nine points each. Kevin Thomas had 12 to lead SUNO, while Berry Jordan had 10 points and a game-high seven rebounds.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
